visuals.title: Shader
visuals.description:
Creates a fantasy image from your webcam's input using a custom shader.
Example found at https://p5js.org/examples/3d-shader-using-webcam.html
The two shader files had to be renamed, since OpenProcessing would not upload them as 'webcam.vert' and 'webcam.frag'. I renamed them as text files and then they uploaded and worked fine! - Richard Bourne

visuals.title: Processing Object Oriented Programming test
visuals.description:
Drag everything around with left click.
Fast (right) click on the squares who come with spheres to enable the particle stream from the square to the corresponding sphere. 
Move both the sphere and the square around. Try to move the squares (the ones who come with no sphere) near the stream of particle.

visuals.title: Voronoi Tessellation at runtime
visuals.description:
"A Voronoi diagram is a partitioning of a plane into regions based on 'closeness' to points in a specific subset of the plane. For each seed there is a corresponding region consisting of all points closer to that seed than to any other."

Click on the screen to create a new point.
For every point, we calculate and show a Voronoi tessellation.

visuals.title: Oil-water phase separation
visuals.description:
A 2D model of how oil and water molecules repel each other with different strengths, making them self-assemble into groups. Based on the PhD thesis of Naoaki Ono.

The mouse controls a water molecule so you can push the oil blobs around.

If you want to play it as a game, try this:

Task 1: push all the blobs together into one big blob.

Task 2: split the big blob into little blobs. You get more points for the more separate blobs you make.

(Note: there aren't any points, you will have to make up your own scoring system.)
visuals.instructions: Move the mouse to push the oil blobs around

visuals.description:
今回のこの作品で通して学んだメディアアートプログラミングの学びとは、理解し続けることだと思います。今まで学んだことの中から作品を作り出すこともできますが、さらにいい作品を作るためには自分のイメージを表せるプログラミングをリサーチして使用します。このように理解し続けること、覚え続けることによって、自分がよりたくさんの表現をすることができ、頭の中のものをプログラミングとして表すことができます。そして、この学びをどうやって得たかと言いますと、僕は雨を表現したいと思いましたが、リサーチをしていくうちに授業で学んだことでは表現できないとおもい、授業で習っていない範囲へと飛び込みました。最初は理解するのに時間がかかりましたが、終わった際の達成感がとても味わえました。とても自分なりのプログラミングをできたのではないかなとおもいます。

参考作品：
https://editor.p5js.org/monicawen/sketches/HkU-BCJqm
https://openprocessing.org/sketch/1162422
https://editor.p5js.org/kelsierose94/sketches/MU2Y21aG0
https://openprocessing.org/sketch/999589

visuals.title: 天気の変わり目
visuals.description:
今回の作品では前回の作品ではできなかった細かな部分に力を入れました。特に苦労したのは雨粒が地面が行った時に透明になってよりリアルな感じを出すところです。そして工夫した点は鳥の2枚の画像を交互に表示することによって飛んでるように見せるところです。今回の作品をを通して学んだプログラミングの意義は分かりやすく書くことです。つまり、プログラミングというものは長くなればなるほど複雑になっていきます。そこで混乱しないために行間を開けたりコメントを書いたりと自分だけではなく色々な人に見やすいように作らなければいけない、他者のことを考えて制作しないといけないと思いました。
参考文献：https://qiita.com/os1ma/items/053486040cd8df599226
https://editor.p5js.org/kelsierose94/sketches/MU2Y21aG0

visuals.title: Recursive Tree
visuals.description:
Since everybody got one: Here is my version of a recursive Tree. The text you see at the bottom of the sketch is the seed value for the random generator. Change the seed and see what happens.

Controls:
- TYPE SOMETHING = create seed
- MOUSECLICK = create random seed and generate tree
- BACKSPACE/DEL = delete last letter
- RETURN/ENTER/CTRL = confirm your seed and generate tree
- ALT = save image

visuals.title: perlin noise redux
visuals.description:
Exploring particles and perlin noise, drawing heavily from Yasai's Perlin Noise. 

The "strength" of the noise is scaled up from the left to the right.

visuals.title: Noise flow field painter
visuals.description:
*It may need a moment to load*

Paints an image with strokes that are rotated by a flow field driven from noise.

If you want to try it on your own image you need to drag and drop an image in the sketch's files tab. Then add your image's file name to the variable imgNames (it's near the top). It doesn't capture details very well so close ups work best.

Controls:
  - Click to change to the next image.
  - Press any key to save the canvas to a jpg.
visuals.instructions: Click for the next image, press a key to save a jpg.

visuals.title: Random dot Autostereogram using depth map
visuals.description:
An autostereogram that first repeats a patterned panel across the window then uses a depth map (as a reference) to displace pixels and create a 3d illusion. 

Press 0-9 to change the image/map. No image is displayed initially.

NVidia stereogram guide:
http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems/gpugems_ch41.html

Most of the Depth maps/images from bitcraft sketch:
http://www.openprocessing.org/sketch/6382

Some code from:
http://bensimonds.com/tag/random-dot-stereogram

visuals.title: Digital Signature909
visuals.description:
Digital Signature created by the transformation path of two randomly generated beziere curves. The text you see at the bottom of the sketch is the seed value for the random generator. Change the seed and see what happens.

Controls:
- TYPE SOMETHING = create seed
- MOUSECLICK = create random seed and generate signature
- BACKSPACE/DEL = delete last letter
- RETURN/ENTER/CTRL = confirm your seed and generate signature
- ALT = save image

visuals.title: quasicrystals
visuals.description:
Points are added by the user drawing on the screen, in principle forming a line.

But these points don't remain still, each point will slowly move away from its nearest neighbour.

A line from each point to its nearest neighbour is drawn, the color depending on the length.

The user can navigate through the view by pressing '+' and '-' (zoom) and the arrow keys (pan). The space bar sets the view still again.

visuals.title: Twk: Particle Simulation, Probabilistic

Click and drag to interact with the particles.

I've made collision detection probabilistic, see class particle_c.  Now has double the number of particles and similar performance level to before.

Working from the Processing.org 2.0 example 'CircleCollision' by Ira Greenberg, based on Keith Peter's solution in Foundation Actionscript Animation: Making Things Move!

visuals.title: 大量のキューブ
visuals.description:
インタラクションのある作品を作るということで、今回僕はスライドバーでX.Y.Zの回転を自由に変更することができる作品を作りました。スライドバーは今回初めて使ったのですが1時間で理解でき、綺麗に組み込むことができてよかったです。
苦労した点：この作品を作るにあたってsin.cosを初めて使ったので、使い方を理解するのに苦労しました。
工夫した点：キューブに色をつけました。というのも、色の付け方がわからなくて、普段使うfill();だと色がつかず最終的にambientMaterialを使って色をつけられました。

作った作品をセーブしていたら、Richard Bourneさんが僕の作品に写真機能を加えたものを作っていていました。https://openprocessing.org/sketch/1217598

参考：https://p5js.org/examples/3d-sine-cosine-in-3d.html

visuals.title: Painting Agents
visuals.description: This is a GOFAI routine for automated agents. We randomly distribute painting agents (or "pens") over the pixel matrix of a photo. Each agent has two functions: to look for a chromatically nearest pixel and to paint a line towards this target pixel. Every target pixel becomes an occupied position in the matrix, so that agents cannot target them again.
visuals.instructions: just reload the sketch for a different painting

visuals.title: Image based one line drawing
visuals.description:
Another drawing machine, creates an one line drawing based on a given image.

Has two modes: Mode one always looks for the nearest neighbor and connects this two points. Mode two looks up for the 7 nearest neighbors and chooses one of these randomly. Last one makes it look more like a natural drawing.

Controls: 
Mouse click == start over
1-9 == particle number (+start)
I == show / hide image
N == connection mode 
M == straight or curly lines

(Photo is takes by me. It's my small Delorean which decorates my desk)

Sample images:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/dianalange/sets/72157632455649148/

visuals.title: Noise flow field painter
visuals.description:
*It may need a moment to load*

Paints an image with strokes that are rotated by a flow field driven from noise.

If you want to try it on your own image you need to drag and drop an image in the sketch's files tab. Then add your image's file name to the variable imgNames (it's near the top). It doesn't capture details very well so close ups work best.

Controls:
  - Click to change to the next image.
  - Press any key to save the canvas to a jpg.
visuals.instructions: Click for the next image, press a key to save a jpg.

visuals.title: Recursive Tree
visuals.description:
Since everybody got one: Here is my version of a recursive Tree. The text you see at the bottom of the sketch is the seed value for the random generator. Change the seed and see what happens.

Controls:
- TYPE SOMETHING = create seed
- MOUSECLICK = create random seed and generate tree
- BACKSPACE/DEL = delete last letter
- RETURN/ENTER/CTRL = confirm your seed and generate tree
- ALT = save image

visuals.description: The FitnessGram Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal bodeboop. A sing lap should be completed every time you hear this sound. ding Remember to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark. Get ready!… Start.

visuals.title: Circulate
visuals.description: Controls: Mouse pressed stops the lines from spiraling inward, and stops showing their paths. Mouse not pressed sends the lines spiraling inward. At first let the mouse hold still in the center for a few seconds, then start. Also try holding down the mouse and moving it around the screen a bit, and then releasing the mouse and hold it perfectly still, watching what happens. The code is relatively easy to figure out, it's a particle system. Enjoy.

visuals.title: abstract01js
visuals.description:
abstract01js is a reworking of an old 2D Processing sketch from 2003, created for for the exhibition Abstraction Now in Vienna.

The 2010 version was recreated using Processing.js for  Aram Bartholl's "Speed Show 4: Super Niche" http://fffff.at/speed-show-4/using Processing.js. It was later featured by Processingjs.org for the 1.0 release.

Another version can be seen here:
http://mariuswatz.com/works/abstract01js/

visuals.title: Maze Generator: Randomized Kruskal's Algorithm
visuals.description:
Another maze generation program. This is one is a lot less fun than the last one but the code is a lot tidier and there is now a working solver. 

For more resources on Kruskal's algorithm, see:
* http://weblog.jamisbuck.org/2011/1/3/maze-generation-kruskal-s-algorithm
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maze_generation_algorithm#Randomized_Kruskal's_algorithm
Basically, it puts the cells into sets, which are all merged (by removing a wall between them) until all the cells are connected. The colors you see are the sets.

Kruskal's algorithm generates perfect mazes with a uniform spanning tree.
visuals.instructions: Use the controls on the right. See description for more info.

visuals.title: expressivedance001
visuals.description: Controls: Mouse pressed stops the lines from spiraling inward, and stops showing their paths. Mouse not pressed sends the lines spiraling inward. At first let the mouse hold still in the center for a few seconds, then start. Also try holding down the mouse and moving it around the screen a bit, and then releasing the mouse and hold it perfectly still, watching what happens. The code is relatively easy to figure out, it's a particle system. Enjoy.
